definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Combs were among the first and most popular objects made of celluloid.
sentences.chinese: 梳子是第一批也是最普遍的用赛璐珞制造的物品之一。

sentences.english: Jenny was playing with her celluloid ducks and ships.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮正在玩她的赛璐珞鸭子和船。

sentences.english: Slow-burning; used instead of celluloid for motion-picture film.
sentences.chinese: 燃烧慢，代替赛璐珞用于电影胶卷中。

sentences.english: But unlike Celluloid, Bakelite would not catch on fire or melt.
sentences.chinese: 与赛璐珞不同，胶木不会着火或融化。

sentences.english: This property has led to a revival of interest in celluloid .
sentences.chinese: 赛璐珞的这一特性，使它再度受到了注意。

sentences.english: He wore a celluloid collar and lace up boots.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿赛璐珞硬领，足登系带长靴。

sentences.english: Coating bamboo with a solution of celluloid in acetone does not exert a water proof effect greatly.
sentences.chinese: 用赛璐珞的丙酮溶液涂布竹材，其防水效力增加不多。

definition: cellulose acetate (used for film and fiber)
bakelite (early plastic)/also written 膠木|胶木[jiao1 mu4]
acrylic (loanword)/see also 亞克力|亚克力[ya4 ke4 li4]
silver halide (usually chloride) used to fix photos
